contentrichtext.text: '''John Caspar Wild''' (1804-August 12, 1846) was an American [[Painting|painter]] and [[lithographer]]. Wild was born in [[Switzerland]] and arrived in the U.S. in the 1830s. He created early city views and landscapes of [[Philadelphia]], [[Cincinnati]], [[St. Louis, Missouri|St. Louis]], and [[Iowa]]. He specialized in hand-colored lithographs. These views, particularly the ''[[Valley of the Mississippi Illustrated]]'' were some of the first depictions of the American West. ==Further reading== * Reps, John William, and J. C. Wild. 2006.
